Articles.Content: Squad is partnered with G2A?????!!?!??!? https://gyazo.com/bdeab1b3f68bb2285e8f43d391b5a35c
Oh damn. SQUAD's become a sellout like ReviewTechUSA.

Looks like just another place selling KSP keys. This is interesting, though:

Apparently the game is half price if you live in the following countries: Russian Federation, Belarus, Ukraine, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Moldova, Republic of, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan. The "Kerbal Space Program - Server" looked exciting (maybe a stock multiplayer leak?) but it turns out to be someone selling server hosting for DMP.

According to www.steamprices.com, on Steam KSP is indeed considerably cheaper in Russia - the equivalent of about £6 or $9. It's the same way for a lot of games, mainly down to the weakening of the rouble and game publishers not yet adjusting their Russian prices.

Of course Valve don't want gamers in other countries taking advantage, and put various obstacles in the way. I don't know if KSP itself has any relevant licensing or technical restrictions though.
I'll look into this. I haven't heard about it before, that's for sure.
